general.title: 1. General Provisions
general.text1: This Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as the 'Policy') describes how Netowork LLC, registration number 123456789, located at 15 Limassol Avenue, Nicosia, 2112, Cyprus (hereinafter referred to as 'We', 'Our Company', 'Netowork', 'us', or 'our') collects, uses, processes, stores, shares, discloses and protects users' personal data (hereinafter referred to as 'You', 'User', 'your') when using the Netowork.com website and related services, applications, tools, and features (collectively, the 'Services').
general.text2: By accessing or using our Services, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with any part of this Policy, you must not use our Services.
general.text3: This Policy is an integral part of our Terms of Service. Any capitalized terms not defined in this Policy shall have the meaning assigned to them in the Terms of Service.
general.text4: We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal information. This Policy explains our practices regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of your information through the use of our Services.

legal_basis.title: 2. Legal Basis for Processing
legal_basis.text1: We process your personal data in accordance with:
items: Your consent (which you can withdraw at any time)
Fulfillment of contractual obligations when you use our Services
Compliance with legal obligations under applicable law
Our legitimate interests, such as improving our Services, ensuring security, and detecting fraudulent activities
Protection of your vital interests or those of another person
legal_basis.text2: We will not process your personal data for purposes incompatible with those disclosed in this Policy without providing you with notice and, if applicable, obtaining your consent.

data_collection.title: 3. Data Collection and Usage
data_collection.text: We collect personal data for specific, explicit, and legitimate purposes, and we do not process it further in a manner incompatible with those purposes. We may collect and process the following categories of personal information:

personal_identifiers.title: 3.1 Personal Identifiers
items: First and last name
Email address
Phone number
User ID and account credentials
Date of birth
Profile information and preferences
Social media account information (when you connect your social media accounts)

technical_data.title: 3.2 Technical Data
technical_data.text: When you interact with our Services, we automatically collect:
items: IP address
Browser type and version
Operating system
Device information (including device ID and model)
User agent strings
Time zone and language settings
Network information
Log data and usage statistics

activity_data.title: 3.3 Activity Data
activity_data.text: Information about your interactions with our Services:
items: Pages or content viewed
Features used
Search queries
Clickstream data
User-generated content
Session duration and frequency
Interactions with other users
Timestamps of activities

location_data.title: 3.4 Location Data
items: Precise location (with your consent, where required)
Approximate location derived from IP address
City and country information

financial_data.title: 3.5 Financial Information
items: Payment method details
Billing address
Transaction history
Subscription information
financial_data.note: Note: Full payment card details are processed by our payment processors, not by Netowork directly.

collection_methods.title: 3.6 Methods of Collection
collection_methods.text: We collect information through various methods:
items: Direct provision by you when you register, create a profile, or use our Services
Automated technologies such as cookies, web beacons, and similar technologies
Third-party sources, including social media platforms (when you link accounts), business partners, and publicly available sources
Analytics providers and advertising networks

purposes.title: 3.7 Purposes of Processing
purposes.text: We use your personal data for the following purposes:
items: Providing, maintaining, and improving our Services
Creating and managing your account
Processing transactions and administering subscriptions
Authenticating users and ensuring security
Personalizing your experience and content
Communicating with you about our Services, updates, and promotional offers
Analyzing usage patterns to improve functionality
Detecting and preventing fraudulent activities, security breaches, and other potentially prohibited or illegal activities
Enforcing our Terms of Service and other legal rights
Complying with legal obligations

data_sharing.title: 4. Data Sharing with Third Parties
data_sharing.text: We value your privacy and do not sell your personal information. However, we may share your information with the following categories of recipients under specific circumstances:

service_providers.title: 4.1 Service Providers
service_providers.text: Third-party vendors, consultants, and service providers who perform services on our behalf, including:
items: Cloud service providers for infrastructure and storage
Payment processors for transaction handling
Customer support services
Email delivery services
Analytics providers
Security and fraud prevention services
service_providers.note: These service providers are contractually bound to use personal information only as necessary to provide services to us and in accordance with our instructions.

business_transfers.title: 4.2 Business Transfers
business_transfers.text: In connection with any merger, sale of company assets, financing, or acquisition of all or a portion of our business by another company, user information may be shared or transferred. We will notify you via email and/or prominent notice on our Services of any change in ownership or uses of your personal information.

legal_requirements.title: 4.3 Legal Requirements
legal_requirements.text: We may disclose your information if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities (e.g., a court or government agency). We may also disclose your information to:
items: Enforce our Terms of Service and other agreements
Protect and defend our rights or property
Prevent or investigate possible wrongdoing in connection with the Services
Protect the personal safety of users of the Services or the public
Protect against legal liability

with_consent.title: 4.4 With Your Consent
with_consent.text: We may share your personal information with third parties when you have given us your consent to do so.

aggregated_data.title: 4.5 Aggregated or De-identified Data
aggregated_data.text: We may share aggregated or de-identified information, which cannot reasonably be used to identify you, for various purposes including improving our Services and developing new features.

international_transfers.title: 5. International Data Transfers
international_transfers.text1: We operate globally and may transfer your personal information to countries other than your country of residence, including Cyprus, where our main servers are located. These countries may have different data protection laws than your country.
international_transfers.text2: When we transfer your personal information internationally, we implement appropriate safeguards in accordance with applicable law to ensure your data remains protected. These safeguards may include:
items: Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the European Commission
Binding Corporate Rules for transfers within our corporate group
Derogations for specific situations, such as your explicit consent
Adequacy decisions recognizing certain countries as providing adequate protection
international_transfers.text3: By using our Services, you acknowledge that your personal information may be transferred to and processed in countries outside your country of residence.

data_protection.title: 6. Data Protection
data_protection.text1: We implement appropriate technical, organizational, and physical safeguards designed to protect your personal information from accidental loss and unauthorized access, use, alteration, or disclosure. These measures include:
items: Encryption of sensitive personal information both in transit and at rest
Regular security assessments and penetration testing of our systems
Implementation of access control mechanisms to limit access to personal information
Monitoring systems for potential security breaches
Regular backups to prevent data loss
Employee training on privacy and security practices
Physical security measures at our facilities
data_protection.text2: While we strive to protect your personal information, no method of electronic transmission or storage is 100% secure. Therefore, we cannot guarantee absolute security. If you have reason to believe that your interaction with us is no longer secure, please immediately notify us by contacting privacy@netowork.com.

data_retention.title: 7. Data Retention
data_retention.text1: We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which we collected it, including to satisfy legal, accounting, or reporting requirements.
data_retention.text2: To determine the appropriate retention period, we consider:
items: The amount, nature, and sensitivity of the personal information
The potential risk of harm from unauthorized use or disclosure
The purposes for which we process the data and whether we can achieve those purposes through other means
Applicable legal, regulatory, or contractual requirements
data_retention.text3: When we no longer need your personal information, we will securely delete or anonymize it. In some circumstances, we may pseudonymize your personal information (so it can no longer be associated with you) for research or statistical purposes, in which case we may use this information indefinitely without further notice to you.

cookies.title: 8. Cookies and Similar Technologies
cookies.text1: Our Services use cookies, web beacons, pixels, and similar tracking technologies to enhance your experience, analyze usage, and deliver personalized content. These technologies collect information about your device, browsing actions, and patterns.

essential.title: 8.1 Essential Cookies
essential.text: Necessary for the operation of our Services, such as session management, authentication, and security. These cookies cannot be disabled.

functional.title: 8.2 Functional Cookies
functional.text: Enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as language preferences and remembering your settings.

analytics.title: 8.3 Analytics and Performance Cookies
analytics.text: Collect information about how you use our Services to help us improve them, such as which pages you visit most frequently.

advertising.title: 8.4 Advertising and Targeting Cookies
advertising.text: Track your browsing habits to deliver advertising relevant to your interests.

cookies.text2: You can manage your cookie preferences through your browser settings. However, disabling certain cookies may limit your ability to use some features of our Services.
cookies.text3: For more detailed information about the cookies we use and how to manage them, please refer to our Cookie Policy.

rights.title: 9. Your Rights
rights.text1: Depending on your jurisdiction, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information, which may include:
items: Right to Access: Request access to the personal information we hold about you.
Right to Rectification: Request correction of inaccurate or incomplete personal information.
Right to Erasure: Request deletion of your personal information under certain circumstances.
Right to Restrict Processing: Request limitation of the processing of your personal information.
Right to Data Portability: Receive your personal information in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format.
Right to Object: Object to processing of your personal information for certain purposes.
Right to Withdraw Consent: Withdraw consent at any time where we rely on consent to process your personal information.
Right to File a Complaint: File a complaint with a supervisory authority.
rights.text2: To exercise your rights, please contact us using the information provided in the 'Contact Us' section. We will respond to your request within the timeframe required by applicable law.
rights.text3: We may need to verify your identity before fulfilling your request. In some cases, we may be unable to fulfill your request, such as when we have a legitimate business or legal reason to retain your information. If we deny your request, we will explain why.

children.title: 10. Children's Privacy
children.text1: Our Services are not directed to individuals under the age of 16. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you are a parent or guardian and believe that your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us so that we can delete such information.
children.text2: If we learn that we have collected personal information from a child under the age of 16 without verifiable parental consent, we will take steps to delete that information as quickly as possible.

changes.title: 11. Changes to the Policy
changes.text1: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time in response to changing legal, technical, or business developments. When we update our Privacy Policy, we will take appropriate measures to inform you, consistent with the significance of the changes we make.
changes.text2: If we make material changes to this Privacy Policy, we will notify you by email or through a notice on our website before the changes become effective. We encourage you to periodically review this Privacy Policy for the latest information on our privacy practices.
changes.text3: Your continued use of our Services after any modifications to the Privacy Policy constitutes your acknowledgment of the modifications and your consent to abide and be bound by the updated Privacy Policy.

dispute_resolution.title: 12. Dispute Resolution
dispute_resolution.text1: If you have any concerns or complaints about our privacy practices, please contact us first. We will try to resolve your concern or complaint.
dispute_resolution.text2: If you are located in the European Economic Area, you have the right to lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority if you are dissatisfied with our response.

contacts.title: 13. Contact Us
contacts.text1: If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Privacy Policy or our privacy practices, please contact our Data Protection Officer:
contacts.address: Postal Address: Netowork LLC, 15 Limassol Avenue, Nicosia, 2112, Cyprus
contacts.form: Online Form: Available on our Contact Us page

california_residents.title: 14. Additional Information for California Residents
california_residents.text1: If you are a California resident, you have specific rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA), including:
items: Right to Know: Request disclosure of the personal information we collect, use, disclose, and sell about you.
Right to Delete: Request deletion of your personal information, subject to certain exceptions.
Right to Correct: Request correction of inaccurate personal information.
Right to Opt-Out: Opt-out of the sale or sharing of your personal information for cross-context behavioral advertising.
Right to Limit Use: Limit the use and disclosure of sensitive personal information.
california_residents.text2: We do not sell your personal information as defined under the CCPA/CPRA. We have not sold your personal information in the preceding 12 months.
california_residents.text3: To exercise your rights, please contact us using the information provided in the 'Contact Us' section or visit our 'Do Not Sell My Personal Information' page. We will verify your request using information you provide.

eea_residents.title: 15. Additional Information for EEA, UK, and Swiss Residents
eea_residents.text1: If you are located in the European Economic Area (EEA), United Kingdom (UK), or Switzerland, you have specific rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) or equivalent laws.
eea_residents.text2: Our legal basis for processing your personal information depends on the specific information and the context in which we collect it. We generally process your personal information only where:
items: We need to perform a contract with you
You have given us consent to do so
The processing is in our legitimate interests and not overridden by your rights
We need to comply with legal obligations
eea_residents.text3: If you have questions about the legal basis for processing your personal information, please contact us using the information provided in the 'Contact Us' section.
